messageBody:
At 07:38 AM 23/05/01, you wrote:
>Hello,
>
>I am new to J2EE and I would really appreciate some help on testing
>my app.
>
>It is similar to the Pet Store example and consists of EJBs, JSPs and
>Servlets.
>
>Could someone please clarify how I go about unit testing these
>components.
>
>Also, could someone please clarify which libraries / tools I use.
>I have searched the WEB and found the following:
>
>1) JUnit3.7
>
>2) Test Infected (from JavaWorld) - which includes JUnit but has
>extra things such as Packer.bat which builds a Test EJB.
>
>3) Cactus - which addresses JSP and Servlet testing but ignores (as
>far as I can tell) EJBs.
>
>4) JUnitEE - Which seems to be very similar to the Test Infected
>stuff from JavaWorld
>
>Any help would be greatly appreciated...


You seem to have already downloaded most of the relevant pacakages: the
only one I would consider adding to this is HttpUnit to help "black box"
testing any html output.

Basically, each package can be used to test certain aspects of the system.
I'd start with JUnit, which is by far the easiest to get up and running.
Use it to test any beans, helper classes etc. Then move on to either
HttpUnit (to test that your outputs are what you expect) or Cactus to test
your server side components - the servlets and jsp. (Incidently, cactus has
its own list which can be reached from jakarta-apache.)
I haven't used JUnitEE, and don't really have enough experience with EJB to
help you on that side.



HTH,
Jim
